feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Application Studio
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Application Studio Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Error: Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 ()
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
Hello @Jitendra_Kansal78, 

I built a SAP MDK Mobile Application via the BAS. 
To do so I created two OData services in my ERP system and two destinations in my BTP account.

The creation of the apps via the CRUD template went well and also the deployment on Android and iOS mobile devices worked perfectly fine. 

I now saw that you can also choose to deploy the app as a Cloud Foundry web application. 
Initially the deployment is completed successfully, but then, when I open the generated link, I get this error message at the top of the main page:
Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 (); GET /nsJobViewerBAS_CRUD/job_infos/ Internal Server Error

I saw these two posts:

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/error-500-get-nsdemosampleapp-com-sap-edm-sampleservice-v2-internal-server/qaq-p/12753245
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/failed-to-initialize-application-data-service/qaq-p/12684025

But no real solution can be found there. I also tried to change the CSDL Options > select IgnoreAllAnnotations & ignoreAllReferences. but sadly it did not work for me. 

Please let me know if I should provide any details.

Best regards,

Manuel

entry.title: BAS issues - performance and space
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

recently we are facing issues with BAS. Local testing of CAP project start time is over 10 minutes, without any major changes. Also BAS space is growing rapidly over time without adding to the project. I have read troubleshooting guides for this but deleting and recreating workspace does not sound like an optimal solution. My project with all npm modules and gen files takes up to 20% yet my workspace is over 90% cappacity.

I am wondering about the root cause and any possible solution for this.

Thanks

entry.title: SmartTable not displaying value text (Text Association) in SAPUI5 app embedded in MyInbox
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I‚Äôm fairly new to SAPUI5 development, so please excuse me if my explanation isn‚Äôt perfectly professional yet üôÇ

I‚Äôm currently working on a freestyle SAPUI5 app that is embedded into MyInbox. In MyInbox, users can handle various tasks ‚Äî including invoice processing tasks.

My app is displayed for those invoice tasks and shows detailed invoice data.

 

What I‚Äôm trying to do

The app first shows invoice header data, and below that, it displays different SmartTables for navigation entities such as GLAccountItems, PurchaseOrderItems, etc.

One example SmartTable looks like this:

This works fine ‚Äî except for one detail:

When I show a field like CostCenter in a SmartField, I get something like this: 1234 (Development General)

But in the SmartTable, I only see: 1234

So the text description (value text) is missing in the table.

 

I‚Äôve learned that this topic is related to Text Associations in SAPUI5 / OData.

 

 

What I found in the metadata

The metadata for the CostCenter field contains a ValueList annotation, which defines its F4 help and seems to refer to a value list entity (VL_SH_FAC_COST_CENTERüòû

Picture 1

The referenced value list entity looks like this (simplified for readability):

Picture 2

From what I understand, sap:text="KTEXT" defines the link between the key (KOSTL) and its text. So I assume this is where the ‚ÄúDevelopment General‚Äù text comes from when using a SmartField.

 

 

Additional metadata section (possibly related)

There‚Äôs also another annotation on the same property that I don‚Äôt fully understand:

Picture 3

Does this Common.v1.Text annotation link the CostCenter key to its text value internally? And if yes ‚Äî why does it work in a SmartField but not inside a SmartTable column?

 

 

What I‚Äôve heard

Apparently, it might be possible to override or extend metadata annotations using a custom annotation file (for example, adding or redefining the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text term).

Would this be a valid approach to make the SmartTable also display the text value (e.g., 1234 (Development General)) instead of only the key?

 

 

My question

How can I make my SmartTable display both the key and the text (using the Text Association) for fields like CostCenter ‚Äî just like SmartField does?

If a custom annotation file is the right way, how exactly should it look like?

If you need additional metadata snippets, project settings, or controller code to help analyze this, I‚Äôm happy to share more details.

 

Thanks so much in advance for any help or best practices you can provide!

entry.title: Fiori Adaptation project Manage Purchase Order V2 to navigate directly to the create PO screen
entry.content:
Dear community, 

Within my company we do have the requirement to directly open the create purchase order screen from the Manage Purchase Order V2 app. However there's no semantic object and action available to do so.

 

I tried the next approach:

  • Create Adaptation project via BAS (Business Application Studio)
  • Create extension controller
  • Implement below code in the method onAfterRendering
sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        // ,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        // ,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton", {
            // metadata: {
            // 	// extension can declare the public methods
            // 	// in general methods that start with "_" are private
            // 	methods: {
            // 		publicMethod: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.Instead /*default*/
            // 		},
            // 		finalPublicMethod: {
            // 			final: true
            // 		},
            // 		onMyHook: {
            // 			public: true /*default*/ ,
            // 			final: false /*default*/ ,
            // 			overrideExecution: OverrideExecution.After
            // 		},
            // 		couldBePrivate: {
            // 			public: false
            // 		}
            // 	}
            // },
            // // adding a private method, only accessible from this controller extension
            // _privateMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a public method, might be called from or overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // publicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding final public method, might be called from, but not overridden by other controller extensions as well
            // finalPublicMethod: function() {},
            // // adding a hook method, might be called by or overridden from other controller extensions
            // // override these method does not replace the implementation, but executes after the original method
            // onMyHook: function() {},
            // // method public per default, but made private via metadata
            // couldBePrivate: function() {},
            // // this section allows to extend lifecycle hooks or override public methods of the base controller
            override: {
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
                // 	 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onInit: function () {
                    console.log("Adaption Bart is triggered.");

                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Similar to onAfterRendering, but this hook is invoked before the controller's View is re-rendered
                // 	 * (NOT before the first rendering! onInit() is used for that one!).
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onBeforeRendering: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the View has been rendered (so its HTML is part of the document). Post-rendering manipulations of the HTML could be done here.
                // 	 * This hook is the same one that SAPUI5 controls get after being rendered.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                onAfterRendering: function () {

                    var oButton = sap.ui.getCore().byId("ui.ssuite.s2p.mm.pur.po.manage.st.s1::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::C_PurchaseOrderTP--addEntry");
                    if (oButton && typeof oButton.firePress === "function") {
                        oButton.firePress();
                    }  
     
                },
                // 	/**
                // 	 * Called when the Controller is destroyed. Use this one to free resources and finalize activities.
                // 	 * @memberOf customer.app.variantbart.clickbutton
                // 	 */
                // 	onExit: function() {
                // 	},
                // 	// override public method of the base controller
                // 	basePublicMethod: function() {
                // 	}
            }
        });
    }
);

The strange thing is that it's working with "Preview Application" in BAS.

But when deployed to the the S4 on-Premise (2023 FPS01) it's not working and throwing an error in the console.

Any thoughts?

Thanks in advance.

Best Regards, Bart

entry.title: External API call from CAP project in BAS
entry.content:
Hi All ,

i am trying to call external API in CAP project "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER"

i am getting  response but no data 

{"@odata.context":"$metadata#A_BusinessPartner","value":[]}".

Service.cds

using { API_BUSINESS_PARTNER as abp } from './external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER.csn';

service BusinessService {  
    entity A_BusinessPartner as projection on abp.A_BusinessPartner {
        key BusinessPartner, Customer, BusinessPartnerFullName, BusinessPartnerGrouping, BusinessPartnerUUID, OrganizationBPName1     }
}

Service.js

const cds = require('@sap/cds');
module.exports = cds.service.impl( async function() {
    const bp = await cds.connect.to('API_BUSINESS_PARTNER');    
    this.on('READ', 'A_BusinessPartner', async req => {        
        return bp.run(req.query);       
    });
})

package.json

{
  "name": "new",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/resilience": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/util": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "express": "^4"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@cap-js/sqlite": "^2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve"
  },
  "private": true,
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER": {
        "kind": "odata-v2",
        "model": "srv/external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
        "credentials": {
          "url": "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
          "headers": {
            "APIKey": "xBKJfJi0dg1AdpCGLYv88WVdFEEy78GP"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

 Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Mass Upload functionality for a custom table in ADT
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm trying to create a table in ADT and  generated an app from it to input data. I also want to add a mass upload functionality using Excel. I have a few questions regarding the best approach:

  1. Can I implement the Excel upload without using BAS, by using actions in the Behavior Definition?

  2. If I use BAS, can I start with a List Report template and later add the Excel upload functionality?

Could you please guide me on how this can be achieved?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Research and Development  ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model SAP Business Application Studio

entry.title: How to Create Destination for S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Service?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm currently trying to connect our internal SAP BTP environment with an S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system, in order to develop Fiori applications using Business Application Studio.

As I understand it, to achieve this, I need to first register the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account, and then create an appropriate Destination within the subaccount.

We have successfully completed the registration of the S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account. However, we are now encountering issues when trying to create the Destination.

As far as I understand, there are two approaches to create the Destination:

  1. Manually configure the Destination
  2. Use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service (plan: api-access) to generate the Destination automatically

We are currently trying the second approach using the Extensibility service, but we are encountering an error during the service instance creation, and thus cannot proceed.

Could you please advise on how to resolve this error, or guide us on the correct way to configure the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service?

For your reference, I have attached images that show the current configuration details and the error message.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:

sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        //,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        //,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.mytimeeventsextension.CustomListReportController", {        
            override: {                
                onExit: function(){
                    debugger;
                },
                test:function(){
                    
                }
            },
            
        });
    }
);

entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here‚Äôs How I‚Äôm Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I‚Äôll study first, what comes next, and how I‚Äôll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it‚Äôs the foundation of most topics in this certification. I‚Äôm spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I‚Äôm following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-programming-model and doing small hands-on exercises along the way.

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I‚Äôll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I‚Äôll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I‚Äôll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I‚Äôll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here‚Äôs the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

  1. Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)
    • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
    • So start here.
  2. Develop Full‚ÄëStack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)
    • Once you know the platform, you learn the developer tooling (BAS = Business Application Studio) which is key for CAP and full-stack apps. 
    • So this is your next step.
  3. Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)
    • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 
  4. Build Side‚Äëby‚ÄëSide Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)
    • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.
  5. Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)
    • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 
  6. Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)
    • This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you‚Äôve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I‚Äôll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you‚Äôre also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

 

I‚Äôd love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.
What topics are you finding most challenging so far and how are you managing the learning.

entry.title: How to access and test an extended Fiori app created with Adaptation Project in BAS?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

I‚Äôm seeking your guidance to understand what steps I need to follow to properly access an extended Fiori app. Let me explain the context:

This week, we extended the standard app ‚ÄúManage Central Purchase Contracts‚Äù using an Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

I had previously done similar extensions using SAP Web IDE, so I assumed the process would be similar. However, I found some differences and a few doubts that I hope you can help me clarify.

After deploying the app to our system, I noticed that the transport request included the following objects, which I hadn‚Äôt seen before:

  • App Variant (LRep cross-client content)

  • LRepository cross-client content

My main question is that I don‚Äôt know where the new app is located or how to verify that the changes were applied correctly.
Do I need any specific role or authorization to access it?

I‚Äôd also like to confirm whether it‚Äôs necessary to configure a Fiori Launchpad tile or perform any additional setup to make the extended app available.
If so, where should I look or what objects should I check?

Lastly, due to client security policies, I must request and justify access to specific transactions. I already have the basic Fiori ones, but I‚Äôd like to know if there are any additional transactions I should request to complete the setup.

Apologies for the number of questions, but this is my first time extending a standard Fiori app from BAS (we usually work with Custom or Fiori Elements apps).

Thank you very much in advance for your help and guidance!

Edson Bravo.

entry.title: How can I load custom CommonHeaderFooterHelper.js file in my Project instead of resources/sap*****/
entry.content:
Hi There,

Good day !
We are working on migration project moving UI5 apps from NEO to CF.

We have some 10 odd HR apps which are copied from or built on sap.ca.scfld.md framework.

These app fail to run in Cloud Foundry with csp error, we raised a case and SAP says we need to rebuild these apps.
The file which is causing this CSP error: sap.ca.scfld.md.app.CommonHeaderFooterHelper.js

'sap/ushell/ui/footerbar/JamShareButton.js': Failed to execute 'sap/ushell/ui/footerbar/JamShareButton.js': Evaluating a string as JavaScript violates the following Content Security Policy directive because 'unsafe-eval' is not an allowed source of script: script-src * data: blob:".

The references failed to load are: (We don't use these buttons on screen)

jQuery.sap.require("sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.JamShareButton");
jQuery.sap.require("sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.JamDiscussButton");
Since rebuilding the apps from scratch is a huge effort and time taking process, as a workaround I am thing of fixing CommonHeaderFooterHelper (removing any references to un used JAM buttons)
Is there a way to reference & load the custom .js file instead from resources?

In search, all references I could find is about custom controls, which would intern extend from original. But in my case if original is loaded the app stops with CSP error.

Thank you,

Sai

entry.title: SAP BAS Cloud Foundry Login Error: Authentication failed. Please try again
entry.content:
At times we get into a situation where things seems to be strange. I would like to share one of such situation with respect to SAP BTP Business Application Studio(BAS) login to Cloud Foundry(CF) for one of the subaccount API endpoint.

Error Authentication failed. Please try again

First thing is to validate if you are using right:

  1. Cloud Foundry API endpoint
  2. Credentials or SSO
  3. Authentication method: 1) Credentials 2) SSO. If SSO then do verify either with a) Default identity provider or b) Alternate identity provider( configured by your enterprise)

If all above are all verified then do check Dev Space on BAS is running out of memory. I did create a new Dev space and CF login was resolved. 

There is a SAP note # 3533620 CF CLI in SAP Business Application Studio fails with error
"Error read/writing config: invalid character '\x00' looking for beginning of value" , however did not try it out.

entry.title: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple OData Services in BAS
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

I would like to ask a question regarding how to manage Destinations on SAP BTP.

So far, we have been using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service to create Destinations for each individual communication scenario (e.g., one for sales order integration, another for purchase order integration).
As a result, we are ending up with multiple Destinations‚Äîone per communication scenario‚Äîthat correspond to each OData service we wish to use.

On the other hand, when connecting BTP with an SAP on-premise system, it has been possible to access various OData services through a single Destination.

Our current objective is to enable a development flow where we can build a Fiori application in BAS and, at the initial data source selection step, choose from various OData services (e.g., purchase, sales, or custom OData) via a single Destination.

However, as it stands, only the OData services associated with the specific communication scenario used when the Destination was created are selectable during BAS development. This limits flexibility in application development.

Is there any recommended configuration or best practice that would allow us to create a single Destination that can be used to access multiple communication scenarios or OData services?

I would greatly appreciate your guidance on this matter.

Thanks,
